channel.title: BBC Sport | Other Sports | Cycling | UK Edition
channel.description: The latest BBC Cycling news plus comment, analysis, results, cycling tips and tactics along with video and audio.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/help/rss/4517815.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: GB success will continue - Clancy
item.description: Ed Clancy believes GB cyclists will deliver Olympic success even if performance director Dave Brailsford leaves his role.

item.title: Chris Hoy learned on girl's bike
item.description: Cyclist Sir Chris Hoy's first bicycle was a girl's bike the Olympic gold medallist's mother reveals.

item.title: Brailsford ponders sprint options
item.description: British Cycling performance director Dave Brailsford refuses to reveal his sprint selection strategy for Sir Chris Hoy and Jason Kenny.

item.title: Hoy takes audacious keirin gold
item.description: Sir Chris Hoy concludes the World Track Cycling in Melbourne with a stunning ride to win the men's keirin gold medal.

item.title: Thomas should snub Games - coach
item.description: British Cycling head coach Shane Sutton says Geraint Thomas should race in the Tour de France instead of going for a second Olympic gold.

item.title: Boonen wins Paris-Roubaix classic
item.description: Belgian Tom Boonen becomes only the second rider to win the Paris-Roubaix classic for the fourth time.

item.title: Bemused Hoy admits lack of desire
item.description: Sir Chris Hoy tells BBC Sport he "wasn't as up for it" as much as earlier in the year after finishing behind Jason Kenny in the World Track Cycling sprint in Melbourne.

item.title: Trott wins gold as Kenny pips Hoy
item.description: Laura Trott wins omnium gold for Britain as Jason Kenny beats Sir Chris Hoy on his way to sprint silver at the World Track Cycling.

item.title: Wounded Pendleton wins world gold
item.description: Track cyclist Victoria Pendleton overcomes a bruising collision with Australia's Anna Meares to win world sprint gold in Melbourne.

item.title: Year ban hurt me - champion Bauge
item.description: Gregory Bauge, who beat Jason Kenny to track cycling's sprint world title in Melbourne, says the fallout from his year-long ban still 'hurts'.

item.title: Boardman to quit GB team position
item.description: Chris Boardman tells the BBC he will end his nine-year association with British Cycling after London 2012.

item.title: GB women smash pursuit world record
item.description: Joanna Rowsell, Dani King and Laura Trott follow their male counterparts in defeating Australia for world team pursuit gold.

item.title: Hoy still searching for answers
item.description: Sir Chris Hoy tells BBC Sport winning three titles at London 2012 is a 'different challenge' to Beijing 2008 and drives him on

item.title: Bring on the Olympics - Thomas
item.description: Geraint Thomas writes for BBC Sport after beating Australia to team pursuit gold in Melbourne thriller

item.title: GB take superb team pursuit gold
item.description: Britain's team pursuit men win a spectacular gold at the World Track Championships as they beat Australia with a world record.
